page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO DEERNESS (1)
page.content: Section 03561005 covers the greater part of Deerness the{ most easterly {parish on the mainland of Orkney.}It is joined by a narrow isthmus of road and sand dunes to the neighbouring parish of St. Andrews and is approximately 12 miles from Kirkwall the main centre of population in the islands. Deerness is principally an {agricultural}area of small mixed farms owned and worked by the family, and being almost an island has many sheltered{sandy beaches.}There is plenty of{birdlife,}and the area is low lying fertile and treeless, with scattered single storey houses. The fields are not large and are divided by fences.Although there are no hills or lochs to vary the scenery, the beautiful green fields and{abundance {of wild flowers}provide one with a sense of nature at its best.
